title: Thanksgiving Leftover Casserole
description: Turkey, mashed potatoes, cheese, a special sauce, and some little extra combine to make a tasty casserole for the day after. Absolutely delicious way to use those tasty Thanksgiving leftovers. Yields 8 servings.

ingredients.item: finely crushed herb-seasoned dry bread stuffing mix

instructions.instruction: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.

Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a saucepan over low heat. Blend in the flour. Slowly stir in evaporated milk and 1 cup water. Bring to a boil, and cook, stirring, until thickened. Stir in 1 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon onion powder. Stir sauce over low heat for 5 minutes.
Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a separate saucepan over low heat, add the dry bread stuffing mix and toss to coat. Spread half of the stuffing mix in the prepared baking dish.
Pour the sauce over the stuffing. Top with turkey meat and shredded cheddar cheese. Top mashed potatoes with the stuffing mixture.
Bake 45 minutes in the preheated oven.
